Articles.Content:
Does adding mass to an orbiting craft (eg adding modules to space station) affect its orbit?

Edited October 18, 2013 by Cdodders

No, but it will effect how maneuverable it is and how it reacts to impact (say, by docking too hard).

Velocity is how orbits change.
I don't think so, unless you accidentally thrust while docking.

If the orbiting object uses RCS for orientation, yes. Adding more mass shifts the center of mass, so the center of RCS thrust is not aligned anymore with it. Every time you try to rotate, you change your orbital parameters slightly.
Plus is it possible to add modules in a linear fashion until it creates a ring around the planet?

Plus is it possible to add modules in a linear fashion until it creates a ring around the planet?

lol-whut? I don't think it would work. Physics only loads at 2.2km or less I think. Besides, your computer would spontaneously combust.
While in theory possible, provided you bring up parts that are ever so slightly curved to follow the planet's curve, I highly doubt the game is capable of handling such a structure.
